benchmark_details.name: PHYSICS ARENA
benchmark_details.overview: PHYSICS ARENA is the first multimodal physics reasoning benchmark designed to holistically evaluate MLLMs across three critical dimensions: Variable Identification, Process Formulation, and Solution Derivation, comprising over 5,000 multimodal instances.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive framework for evaluating the multimodal physics reasoning capabilities of MLLMs.

data.source: Custom collection of high-school physics problems, involving textual components and associated visual materials.
data.annotation: Expert annotated with categories of physical variables and processes.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated based on comparisons of the model output against ground truth annotations for each dimension.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better reasoning capabilities in variable identification, process formulation, and solution derivation.
methodology.validation: Rigorous manual review and validation of a stratified subset of problems.
